Package gw.api.database.upgrade.before

Interface IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder

public interface IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder
Inserts some values in the given table

    • withLogSQL

      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
      Turns on or off SQL logging. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level
      Parameters:
      logSQL - true to log SQL, false to not
      Returns:
      the this ptr

    • withSkipDefaultBehavior

      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder withSkipDefaultBehavior(boolean skip)
      This operation is able to set defaults for some well known fields, such as BeanVersion. However, before upgrade, this involves checking whether the column exists (we don't have metadata information). In some cases, this behavior is not desirable because of the cost to ping the database, e.g. in tests. Use true here if you have mapped all the desired fields and don't require the default behavior.
      Parameters:
      skip - true to skip automated behavior
      Returns:
      this

    • execute

      int execute()
      Executes the query. If already in a transaction, the query executes in that transaction; otherwise a new transaction is created and committed when the method returns, or rolled back if the method throws an exception. The statement that is constructed will perform default behavior for the following columns (if present and not mapped):- ID (keyable beans only): using a new key from the KeyGenerator PublicID (keyable beans only): using a new value from the PublicIDGenerator BeanVersion: 0 CreateTime: current time CreateUser: the current user UpdateTime: current time UpdateUser: the current user Retired: 0
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected

    • getSQLs

      List<String> getSQLs()
      Gets the SQL that will be executed when execute() is called.
      Returns:
      the SQL that will be executed
